intro: Hugonia platysepala, commonly known as the broad-sepal hugonia, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have five sepals that are broad and lanceolate in shape. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds.
